summaryText: What an incredible message about hope during seasons of drought! Pastor Darrison Tellez delivered a powerful sermon that reminds us God is always working, even when we can't see it. Drawing from the story of Elijah praying for rain in 1 Kings 18, PT explores how those 'nothing' moments aren't actually nothing - they're preparation! Sometimes God delays His assistance not because He's neglecting us, but because He's developing something far greater. Can you imagine waiting six times and seeing absolutely nothing, and then suddenly on the seventh time, a tiny cloud appears? That's exactly what happened with Elijah, and it's a powerful metaphor for our own spiritual journeys. Pastor Darrison challenges us to stop despising small beginnings and recognize that God rejoices to see the work start. Whether you're in a season of waiting, feeling overlooked, or wondering if God has forgotten you, this message is a reminder that what looks like 'nothing' might actually be God's most significant preparation yet. The miracle always starts with the small thing we have in our hand!
mainPoints: God is working even when you can't see progress
Your valley is not in vain

versesMentioned.text: So we don't look at the troubles that we can see now, rather we fix our gaze on things that cannot be seen. For the things we see now will soon be gone.
Do not despise these small beginnings, for the Lord rejoices to see the work begin.
Let us not become weary in doing good, for at the proper time we will reap a harvest if we do not give up.

As he went along, he saw a man blind from birth. His disciples asked him, 'Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?' 'Neither this man nor his parents sinned,' said Jesus, 'but this happened so that the works of God might be displayed in him.'

Monday.scripture: Psalm 27:14: 'Wait for the Lord; be strong and take heart and wait for the Lord.'
Monday.action: Identify one area in your life where you've been impatient. Write down three potential reasons God might be asking you to wait in this season.
Monday.prayer: Lord, teach me patience. Help me trust Your timing and understand that Your delays are not denials, but preparations. Give me wisdom to see the purpose in my waiting. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Isaiah 40:31: 'But those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint.'
Tuesday.action: Create a 'testimony wall' of past challenges where God showed up. Reflect on how those experiences built your faith.
Tuesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, remind me of Your faithfulness. Help me remember that every challenge is an opportunity for growth and Your glory. Renew my hope and strength today. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Jeremiah 29:11: 'For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.'
Wednesday.action: List three current uncertainties in your life. Pray over each one, surrendering your plans and asking God to reveal His purpose.
Wednesday.prayer: God, I surrender my timeline and expectations to You. Help me trust that Your plan is perfect, even when I can't understand it. Give me peace and wisdom. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Romans 8:28: 'And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.'
Thursday.action: Identify one current struggle. Journal how this challenge might be preparing you for something greater.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, help me see beyond my current circumstances. Show me how You're working all things together for my good and Your glory. Give me spiritual eyes to understand Your process. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Habakkuk 2:3: 'For the revelation awaits an appointed time; it speaks of the end and will not prove false. Though it linger, wait for it; it will certainly come and will not delay.'
Friday.action: Practice a spiritual discipline that builds your faith - extended prayer, fasting, or deep Bible study focused on God's promises.
Friday.prayer: Father, strengthen my faith during this season of waiting. Help me not grow weary, but to trust in Your perfect timing and plan. Refresh my spirit and renew my hope. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: James 1:2-4: 'Consider it pure joy, my brothers and sisters, whenever you face trials of many kinds, because you know that the testing of your faith produces perseverance. Let perseverance finish its work so that you may be mature and complete, not lacking anything.'
Saturday.action: Reflect on personal growth from past challenges. Write a letter of gratitude to God for how He's transformed you through difficult seasons.
Saturday.prayer: Gracious God, thank You for never leaving me and for using every season to mold me into Your image. Help me embrace growth, trust Your process, and remain faithful. Amen.
